pullRequest.body:
Replaces two `DecidableEq` instances in `ModelTheory/Ring/Basic` with more general instances.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [f7d0b65c2c](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15901/commits/f7d0b65c2c8345cc81ef64a93d8f091cb09518a1)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ instDecidableEqFunctions`
`+ instDecidableEqRelations`
`+ instance [DecidableEq a₀] [DecidableEq a₁] [DecidableEq a₂] {n : ℕ} :`
`- instance (n : ℕ) : DecidableEq (Language.ring.Functions n) := by`
`- instance (n : ℕ) : DecidableEq (Language.ring.Relations n) := by`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

:v: awainverse can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10428319064/job/28884323890)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10428319064/job/28884324085)

```suggestion
instance [DecidableEq a₀] [DecidableEq a₁] [DecidableEq a₂] {n : ℕ} :
    DecidableEq (Sequence₂ a₀ a₁ a₂ n) :=
  match n with
  | 0 | 1 | 2 => ‹_›
  | _ + 3 => inferInstance
```
If `inferInstance` can find these, they're probably not very useful as `instances`; so maybe just make them `example`s?

These are the things that replace the deleted lines in `ModelTheory.Ring.Basic` - somehow these declarations still help it find these instances. I'd love to know why and find a better solution, but for now, something like these is necessary.
Please add a comment to that effect (and an `example` to replace the deleted lines in `ModelTheory.Ring.Basic` to demonstrate that the instances work)

```suggestion
instance instDecidableEqRelations {f : ℕ → Type*} {R : ℕ → Type*} (n : ℕ) [DecidableEq (R n)] :
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(ModelTheory): More general ways of deriving `DecidableEq` for logic symbols
